intro: Oporanthus citrinus, commonly known as the citron weed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellowish flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields and along roadsides. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in composite heads. Oporanthus citrinus is considered a weed in some areas due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
